and shooting such a bed is uh nice but

light over here at the side now I used a
strong speed light guide number 58 but I
dialed the power way down to 13 second

was quite small and got white walls so I
don't need so much light
actually and I did let it go through a

uh sheets quite threedimensional uh the

for shallow death of field IO 100 but I

delivering very bluish daylight quality
light now of roughly 5,800 Kelvin but I
wanted to turn the thing into a very

scene that is why I dialed up the um

there it's uh not quite as strong guide
number 43 it's also dialed down to 13
second of it power and it's going
through a lamp shade yeah a lamp shade
of a bedside lamp actually the speed
light is inside the lamp so when you see
the lamp in the photograph now the
camera is shooting right uh towards the
lamp when you see it it looks like the
lamp is glowing but what you actually
see is the speed light going off inside
the lamp now that gives the photos quite
a bit of punch and it's very easy to do
yeah just take a lampshade put a speed
light inside there there you go there
you got your punch and yeah well that's
all it takes so it's not so much gear
